content: this legal case took place in the municipal court split and involved two parties in a coownership agreement the procedure started on july 12 2020 and lasted from january 30 onwards the coownership property was dissolved after a 3year and 11month process the petitioner was allocated a duplex apartment on the first and second floors while the counterparty was allocated an apartment on the ground floor the communication between the floors was facilitated by an internal wooden staircase and access to the residential units was provided through a shared courtyard and an external singleflight staircase the decision was based on specific articles of the property act the petitioner submitted a proposal to terminate the coownership but the parties had different opinions on the division particularly regarding the basement space the petitioner was willing to enter an agreement and pay 13 of the property value increased by 10 including maintenance costs however the counterparty disagreed and suggested a physical division proposing an additional expert examination the court accepted the experts opinion and decided on the method of terminating the coownership after the proceedings the judge assessed a geometrical division for the registration of specific parts the coowners had the right to terminate the coownership according to the law and the judge considered agreements and the right to termination payment the costs of termination were to be borne by the coowners according to their shares unless otherwise specified by law or agreement
